intro: Cupheanthus neocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonian cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub with dense, evergreen foliage and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
